DOC.brief_summary: Comparative study conventional fast versus overnight infusion lipid carbohydrate free fatty acid insulin obese patient undergo elective first time on-pump coronary artery bypass grafting .
DOC.brief_title: Conventional Fasting Versus Lipid/Carbohydrate Infusion Coronary Bypass Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Obese patient schedule bypass surgery randomly assign three group : Group I ( Glucose-group ) : patient receive 500 cc glucose 10 % contain 50 g glucose provide patient 200 Kcal osmolarity 556 mosm/L . Group II ( Lipid-group ) : patient receive 100 cc lipid solution ( soybean 30 % , medium chain triglyceride 30 % , olive oil 25 % , fish oil 15 % 20 mg vitamine E ) contain 20 g lipid provide patient 200 Kcal osmolarity 380 mosm/L . Group III ( Control-group ) : patient fast overnight 11 pm till 9 except clear fluid allow till 5 .
DOC.criteria: Adult patient ( > 18 year ) American Society Anesthesia ( ASA ) class IIIII , BMI 3040 , New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) functional capacity III , undergo elective onpump coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) use cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) . All patient type 1a World Health Organisation ( WHO ) /Fredrickson classification primary hyperlipidemia . Patients diabetes mellitus Patients fibrates Patients type 1,2b,3,4 5 WHO/Fredrickson classification primary hyperperlipidemias Patients history allergic reaction fish , egg yolk contain food peanut soy product Patients carbohydrate fat intolerance
